chunks.en: BYD is going crazy! Last night's launch included intelligent driving features on cars under 100,000 yuan. What do you think about BYD's future development or stock price?

chunks.en: I'm curious about something. 99,800 yuan, 4.8 meters long, 1.9 meters wide, 12 cameras, 5 millimeter-wave radars, 12 ultrasonic radars, capable of automatic parking, highway navigation, and remote control via mobile phone, 6 airbags, configured with 360Â° panoramic imaging, can run on electricity and gasoline, 0-100 acceleration in 7.9 seconds... Can you find a second car like this in the world?
If Toyota made such a car and sold it for 99,800 yuan, what would you V-friends think?

chunks.zh: PSï¼šå”®ä»· 20 ä¸‡+çš„ï¼Œæ–°æ¬¾ model3 å’Œ model Y å…¨é¢è½¬å‘äº†è§†è§‰æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Œè½¦å¤–ä¸€é¢—é›·è¾¾ä¹Ÿæ²¡æœ‰ï¼Œä¸ç®¡æ˜¯æ¯«ç±³æ³¢è¿˜æ˜¯è¶…å£°æ³¢ï¼Œæ›´åˆ«ææ¿€å…‰é›·è¾¾ã€‚
chunks.en: PS: The new Model 3 and Model Y, priced at 200,000+ yuan, have completely switched to a visual solution, with no radar outside the car, neither millimeter-wave nor ultrasonic, let alone lidar.
@ugpu Toyota wouldn't dare to cut corners. You're making me laugh. Or should we praise Tesla instead?
'BYD is going crazy'. Seeing this kind of wording makes me inexplicably disgusted.
What's the use? You can only watch when it catches fire.
@ugpu #47 Guess how many times Toyota bowed last year?
And some people are still praising this garbage?
'How fragile the suspension of low-end electric cars is', 'Low-end electric cars will fall apart after running 100KM', 'Toyota, as a foreign company, wouldn't dare to cut corners'.
Let's see from what angles V friends will criticize domestic products.
@frankkly Would it be better if it were changed to 'Tesla is going crazy'? ğŸ¶
@maichael Confirms Eunuch Shen's famous quote: 'Prejudice in people's hearts is like a mountain'.
New car owners buy BYD cars, old car owners buy BYD stocks, a win-win.
@mc2tap " 'Self-driving is all nonsense; creating something pretentious is all deception; it's a case of the emperor's new clothes'." That's what he said.
@mc2tap He opposes fully autonomous driving; he strongly supports intelligent driving.

chunks.en: @ThomasKim Let me tell you why I hate this BYD thing. I'm an experienced driver. First, you're buying a car, not a bunch of smart devices. Do you see how fragile the suspension of low-end electric cars is?
Second, they tell me that low-end electric cars will fall apart after running 100KM.

chunks.zh: ç¬¬ä¸‰ é‡ç‚¹: ä¹°çš„æ˜¯ä¸ªè½¦ å¯èƒ½æ˜¯ MPV å®¶ç”¨ å¯èƒ½æ˜¯å°è½¦ä»£æ­¥ å¯èƒ½æ˜¯ suv æ›´å…·å¤‡æˆ·å¤–ä½“éªŒ. ä¸æ˜¯ä¸€å †ç”µå­äº§å“é«˜ç§‘æŠ€
chunks.en: Third, and most importantly, you're buying a car, maybe an MPV for family use, maybe a small car for commuting, maybe an SUV for a better outdoor experience, NOT a bunch of electronic gadgets and high technology.
Fourth: Foreign companies like Toyota wouldn't dare to cut corners; they can't do it for now, pushing certain values to the threshold, etc. If discovered, their global business would be gone.
It's not worth sacrificing integrity for a small benefit, but Toyota might sacrifice integrity for a larger one in the future.

The last one to play with commercial paper in the supply chain was Evergrande. BYD's DiChain plays it even more intricately, it's Evergrande's commercial paper 2.0 version. When it dies, it will definitely be more miserable than Evergrande.
@oldersnail First, I'm not praising Toyota.
Second, according to you, even if Toyota is garbage, it still holds its value in the used car market.
Third, some car companies don't even dare to bow; they directly silence those who raise questions.
@ugpu #56 Still holds its value? Look at how much the price of new cars has dropped in three years.
I remember a few years ago Wang Chuanfu looked down on intelligent driving, didn't he?
Winning big time, can still suppress the wages of wage slaves.
@tigerstudent That's a problem of excessive marketing; you should criticize the excessive marketing, not the thing itself.

@ODESZA Didn't you see the bunch of wage slaves getting excited above? This kind of company is a price butcher externally and a sweatshop internally. It's clear where the costs are being cut. Let them continue to get excited.
